0.title: Man who got world's 1st pig heart transplant dies after 2 months in US
0.article_body: The first person to receive a heart transplant from a pig has died two months after the surgery, the US hospital that performed the surgery announced on Wednesday. While doctors didn't give an exact cause of death, they said 57-year-old David Bennett's condition had begun deteriorating several days earlier. He got a transplant from a genetically modified pig.

1.title: Cong doesn't trust them: Goa CM after party moves candidates to resort
1.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant has said that Congress doesn't trust its candidates after the party reportedly moved its candidates to a resort ahead of Assembly election results. "[Congress is] keeping [candidates] in isolation...without knowing who's winning," he added. Reacting to the possibility of hung Assembly, Sawant said independent candidates will back BJP if it falls short of a majority.

2.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of holding 4,00,000 'hostage' in Mariupol
2.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday accused Russia of holding 4,00,000 people 'hostage' in Mariupol and blocking humanitarian aid and evacuation. He took to Twitter and said that almost 3,000 newborn babies lack medicine and food in the city. "I urge the world to act! Force Russia to stop its barbaric war on civilians and babies!" the minister added.

3.title: Redmi launches Note 11 Pro series & Redmi Watch 2 Lite in India today
3.article_body: All-new Redmi Note 11 Pro+ 5G and Redmi Note 11 Pro were launched today. The latest Redmi Note devices that sport 67W Turbo charging promise a full day's charge in just 15 minutes. Redmi also launched Redmi Watch 2 Lite alongside the two smartphones in what was Xiaomi's first on-ground tech launch event of 2022.

4.title: Woman with 2 uteruses gives birth to 2 babies in a year in US, pic surfaces
4.article_body: A woman from Georgia, US gave birth to two babies in one year, as they each grew in her two different uteruses. Caroline Wortman, 30, discovered she was nearly ten weeks pregnant with her second child, just six months after her daughter's birth. She suffers from a rare condition called uterine didelphys, meaning she was born with two reproductive systems.

5.title: World no. 2 Djokovic added to Indian Wells draw despite vaccine status
5.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has been added to the Indian Wells draw despite doubts whether he can play in the US event due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated to enter the country. Djokovic, who was deported from Australia due to his vaccine status, recently revealed he remains unvaccinated.

6.title: FIFA suspend Ukraine’s WC playoff against Scotland amid war with Russia
6.article_body: FIFA on Tuesday said it suspended Ukraine's World Cup qualifying playoff match against Scotland following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The match was scheduled to be played on March 24. FIFA added Poland has received a bye through their playoff match against Russia that was scheduled to be played the same day. Ukraine's match with Scotland will be organised in June.

7.title: We're going to get clear majority in Goa polls: Cong's Chidambaram
7.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram expressed confidence in the party's victory in the Goa Assembly elections and stated that Congress is going to get a "clear majority". Chidambaram's comment comes after Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar claimed that talks are underway with Aam Aadmi Party to obtain support for government formation. Exit polls have predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

8.title: Ukraine warns of risk of radiation leak after power cut at Chernobyl nuclear plant
8.article_body: Ukrainian nuclear company Energoatom has warned of radiation leak from the occupied Chernobyl nuclear power plant because it cannot cool spent nuclear fuel due to power cut. "The radioactive cloud could be carried by wind to other regions of Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, and Europe," it added. Ukraine has appealed to Russia for a temporary ceasefire to repair the power line.

9.title: Puducherry minister dresses as Goddess, says, 'Knew there'll be -ve feedback'
9.article_body: A video of Puducherry minister S Chandira Priyanga dressed as Goddess was released on Women's Day. After the clip got criticism from few, she said she knew there'll be negative feedback but doesn't care about it. "It's not like putting just another get-up...I underwent fasting and stopped eating non-vegetarian food as I feel this is a sacred thing," she said.

10.title: Upper age limit for appearing in NEET-UG examination removed
10.article_body: Upper age limit for appearing in the undergraduate medical entrance exam, NEET-UG, has been removed for all candidates, the National Medical Commission has said. Earlier, the age limit was 25 years for General category candidates and 30 years for Reserved category candidates. The decision was taken in the fourth NMC meeting held in October last year, the commission's secretary said.

11.title: Sreesanth retires from all forms of Indian domestic cricket
11.article_body: Cricketer Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket aged 39. In a video posted on Twitter, Sreesanth said he's looking forward to be a part of a coaching setup and also expressed his interest in playing leagues across the globe once BCCI allows. Sreesanth's seven-year ban over IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal had ended in September 2020.

12.title: 20,000 foreigners joined Ukraine forces to fight against Russia: Report
12.article_body: Around 20,000 foreigners have joined Ukrainian forces to fight against Russia amid the ongoing war, The Kyiv Independent reported. "Foreign volunteers will be able to obtain Ukrainian citizenship if they want to," it quoted Ukraine's First Deputy Interior Minister Yevhen Yenin as saying. There have been reports of citizens of various nations, including India, volunteering to fight for Ukraine.

13.title: BJP wins 759, Congress 76 of 977 wards in Assam Municipal Board election
13.article_body: The BJP won 759 of the total 977 municipal wards in the Assam Municipal Board election on Wednesday, while the Congress managed to secure a win in 76 wards, the state Election Commission said. Polling for one ward will be done later as a candidate died in the Patacharkuchi municipal board. As many as 59 wards were uncontested.

14.title: Ashneer Grover, wife Madhuri pay ₹8.2 crore advance tax: Report
14.article_body: Former BharatPe Managing Director Ashneer Grover has paid ₹7.1 crore advance tax for the assessment year 2022-23, as per a PTI report. Grover's wife Madhuri Jain has paid ₹1.1 crore advance tax, the report said. "This makes him one of the highest taxpayers among startup founders for two years in a row," PTI added while quoting a source.

15.title: Varanasi officer removed after controversy over EVMs' transportation
15.article_body: Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma has removed ADM NK Singh over charges of dereliction of duty while transporting EVMs to be used for training ahead of counting of votes in UP. The order said the EVMs were supposed to be transported on Wednesday after informing political parties. Since they weren't informed, confusion followed and hence, Singh has been removed.

16.title: Ukraine bans exports of food staples to prevent 'humanitarian crisis'
16.article_body: Ukraine's government has banned the export of wheat and other food staples to prevent a "humanitarian crisis" in the country amid the Russian invasion, a report stated. It has also prohibited the export of buckwheat, meat and other "byproducts" from cattle. Ukraine's minister Roman Leshchenko said the export ban is needed to "meet the population's need in critical food products".

17.title: Sweden prepares tents, warehouses as refugees from Ukraine arrive
17.article_body: Sweden is preparing tents, sports halls and warehouses to accommodate refugees from Ukraine, Swedish Immigration Minister Anders Ygeman said on Wednesday. Swedish Migration Board is reportedly making arrangements to house approximately 30,000 Ukrainian refugees over the coming months, although the number of arrivals could be higher. Around 2,000 refugees arrived in Sweden on Tuesday, Ygeman added.

18.title: Russia warns as Poland offers to send MIG-29 jets to Ukraine, calls it 'dangerous'
18.article_body: Russia has issued a warning after Poland offered to deliver all of its MIG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine after flying them to a US airbase. "This is a highly undesirable and a potentially dangerous scenario," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. The MIG-29 is a fighter jet that was developed in the Soviet Union.

19.title: MCD polls likely to be delayed; Delhi CM asks, 'Can Centre direct EC?'
19.article_body: Delhi State Election Commissioner SK Srivastava on Wednesday didn't announce dates for MCD polls as EC received a communication from Centre regarding unification of municipal bodies. He said the polls aren't being delayed but EC is seeking legal opinion. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal questioned whether Centre can direct EC to delay polls. "Why is EC buckling under pressure?" he asked.

20.title: Man accused in POCSO case arrested by Delhi Police after 3 years
20.article_body: A 32-year-old man, accused in a Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act case, has been arrested by police after absconding for the past three years. The accused, identified as Sandeep Kumar, of Nangloi, was arrested after his location was tracked down by a police team constituted to keep surveillance on proclaimed offenders. He was first arrested in 2013.

21.title: Hyderabad Mayor shares video of her having lunch with women workers
21.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal shared on Twitter a video of her having lunch with women workers of the civic body on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. "Heartfelt moment to have lunch with the brave women of GHMC...Their contribution in keeping the city clean is commendable," the Mayor wrote on Twitter.

22.title: Pregnant women among 4,000 Better.com workers laid off on Women's Day, says employee
22.article_body: Better.com employee Eric Blattberg shared a colleague's post regarding layoff of roughly 4,000 employees on Tuesday. "Included in...laid-off crowd are pregnant women who trusted Better with their stability," it read. "I wanted to share [the] post calling on Better's leadership...to provide extended medical benefits to currently-pregnant employees they're laying off on...Women's Day," wrote Eric.

23.title: Will stay common man even if I become Punjab CM: AAP's Bhagwant Mann
23.article_body: Ahead of the Punjab Assembly election results, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said on Wednesday that he will remain a common man even if he gets elected as the CM. "I don't think...politics will mess my head if I [win]," Mann added. Exit polls have indicated a victory for Aam Aadmi Party in Punjab.

24.title: Over 400 people detained by Russian National Guard in Kherson: Ukraine
24.article_body: Ukraine's military high command said on Wednesday that members of Russia's National Guard have detained more than 400 people in Ukraine's Kherson oblast. It said that the people had protested against the occupation of their hometowns by Russian forces. "Due to the furious resistance of the residents of Kherson, the occupiers are attempting to introduce an administrative-police regime," it said.

25.title: Mumbai civic body begins dismantling 4 of 9 jumbo COVID-19 centres
25.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has begun the process of dismantling jumbo COVID-19 centres in Mumbai's Goregaon, Dahisar, Kanjurmarg and Mulund. The centres have begun making equipment inventories and physical dismantling of structures will soon follow, said BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani. Their equipment will be distributed to tertiary and peripheral hospitals, he added.

26.title: Russian soldier given 'wedding suit' to wear after he surrenders uniform in Ukraine
26.article_body: Ukraine Security Service has released a picture of a Russian soldier after capturing him. "The Russian invader was so eager to surrender to the Ukrainians that he surrendered not only his weapons but also his uniform. That is why he is being interrogated by the SBU in a wedding suit given to him out of pity by Ukrainians," it tweeted.

27.title: Arvind Kejriwal will be Prime Minister soon: AAP's Raghav Chadha
27.article_body: AAP MLA Raghav Chadha on Wednesday said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "will definitely be seen in [the role of] Prime Minister soon". He added that AAP has emerged as a national political force and that it will be Congress' national and natural replacement. "Not even 10 years since AAP's inception and we're forming government in two states," he added.

28.title: Flight services from Puducherry to B'luru, Hyd to resume from Mar 27
28.article_body: The flight services from Puducherry to Bengaluru and Hyderabad would be resumed from March 27, according to a news report. A press release from the office of the Puducherry Chief Minister N Rangasamy said on Wednesday that booking of tickets to the two cities has begun. Notably, the services were suspended because of the outbreak of COVID-19.

29.title: Must be something special about turning 66: Tharoor as Shah calls to wish him on b'day
29.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said Home Minister Amit Shah called him to wish him on his birthday. "Surprised and touched to receive a telephone call from Home Minister [Amit Shah] wishing me on my birthday. There must be something special about turning 66! Most grateful for the kind words," Tharoor tweeted.

30.title: East coast floods to be declared a national emergency in Australia
30.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Wednesday said the floods across Australia's east coast that have killed 22 people due to heavy rains will be declared a national emergency. Morrison said the declaration will "ensure all our emergency powers are available and that we cut through any red tape we might face in delivering services and support on the ground".

31.title: Students in Ukraine didn't take advisory seriously: Piyush Goyal
31.article_body: Neither did Indian students in Ukraine take the government's advisory seriously nor did their universities allow them to leave, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday. He claimed 4,000 people returned before the war broke out and more could have come. "Many countries floundered in evacuating citizens from Ukraine. India still evacuated its citizens through neighbouring nations," he added.

32.title: Rahul shares pic of him having ice cream in Wayanad on Instagram
32.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday took to Instagram to share a picture of him having ice cream in his parliamentary constituency of Wayanad in Kerala. "Many flavours of Wayanad!" Rahul captioned the post. In 2018 also, Rahul was spotted in an ice cream parlour in Madhya Pradesh's Indore along with his party workers.

33.title: SII's Covovax gets emergency use nod by DCGI for adults & for children above age 12
33.article_body: Serum Institute of India's Covovax has been granted Emergency Use Authorisation by DCGI for adults and for children above the age of 12, tweeted CEO Adar Poonawalla on Wednesday. "Younger age groups will follow shortly," he added. Novavax in global trials has demonstrated more than 90% efficacy, Poonawalla's tweet read.

34.title: Kerala Cong chief's life is alms given by our party: CPI(M) leader
34.article_body: CPI(M)'s CV Varghese has triggered a controversy by saying that the life of Kerala Congress chief K Sudhakaran is "alms given by CPI(M)". "We're not interested in killing a wicked person," he said. Later, Varghese claimed Sudhakaran had defended the killers of an SFI worker. "My speech was in tune with the demands of that particular situation," he said.

35.title: Kapil Dev sent a bouquet and a small handwritten note home: Ashwin on breaking his record
35.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, who overtook Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest Test wicket-taker, said Kapil sent a bouquet and a small handwritten congratulatory note home. He added, "Sometimes people do forget that people like Kapil Dev, Sachin Tendulkar, Anil Kumble, Harbhajan Singh, those who have done incredible things in the past are one of the reasons why I'm sitting here today."

36.title: Austria suspends its mandatory COVID-19 vaccine law
36.article_body: Austria is suspending its COVID-19 vaccine mandate which took effect as law last month. "We see no need to...implement...[law] due to...[Omicron] variant that we're predominantly experiencing here,” an Austrian minister said. The mandate required those aged 18 and above to provide proof of vaccination to authorities, a failure of which could attract fines up to €3,600 (over ₹3 lakh).

37.title: 36-year-old man runs car over pet dog in Greater Noida; arrested
37.article_body: Police have arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly mowing down a pet dog with his car in Greater Noida. A police spokesperson said, "The incident [occurred] on February 28 when Zorah, the pet (Siberian husky)...was mowed down with a Toyota Innova Crysta by [the accused]." The pet's owner filed a complaint against the accused man, following which he was arrested.

38.title: SIT formed to probe triple murder case at CNG station in Gurugram
38.article_body: Gurugram's Commissioner of Police Kala Ramachandran formed a five-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) on March 4 to investigate the murder of three employees of a CNG station in Sector 31 on February 28, police said. Police stated that the SIT is headed by Assistant Commissioner of Police (Sadar) Aman Yadav and supervised by Deputy Commissioner of Police (east) Virender Vij.

39.title: Opp'n has accepted defeat that's why they're blaming EVMs: BJP leader
39.article_body: BJP leader Shrikant Sharma on Wednesday said that the Opposition has accepted their defeat in the UP Assembly elections and that's why they're blaming the electronic voting machines (EVMs). He further said that the Samajwadi Party government had only served the interests of particular castes. "People had rejected him (Akhilesh Yadav) in the 2017 elections," Sharma further said.

40.title: Pune district records 235 new COVID cases, 1 death on Tuesday
40.article_body: Maharashtra's Pune district on Tuesday recorded total 235 new COVID-19 cases and one coronavirus-related death. According to the state health department, the total new cases include 72 cases of Pune rural, 133 cases of Pune city and 30 new cases of PCMC. The district, as of Tuesday, reportedly saw the registration of 17.38 million COVID-19 vaccine doses.

41.title: Proposal to rename Delhi's Hauz Qazi Chowk as Hari Chand Verma Chowk withdrawn
41.article_body: AAP councillor Rakesh Kumar's proposal to rename Old Delhi's Hauz Qazi Chowk to Hari Chand Verma Chowk was withdrawn after uproar over social media and opposition by Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor. Verma was a former Congress leader and councillor. The proposal was given anticipatory approval by North Delhi Municipal Corporation mayor and BJP leader Raja Iqbal Singh.

42.title: Sri Lanka's most sacred elephant Nadungamuwa Raja dies aged 68
42.article_body: Sri Lankan authorities said a state funeral will be held for Nadungamuwa Raja, the country's most sacred elephant, which died aged 68 on Monday near Colombo. Raja was born in India in 1953 and reportedly gifted as one of two calves to a Sri Lankan monk by the King of Mysore. Raja's remains will be stuffed and preserved for posterity.

43.title: 2 Andhra men attempt to sexually assault Lithuanian tourist, arrested
43.article_body: Police have arrested two youth in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore for attempting to sexually assault a 27-year-old Lithuanian tourist. The accused, Sai Kumar, took dollars worth ₹5,000 from the woman and took her to his village promising to return the remaining money. Meanwhile, Kumar called his friend Sheikh Abid, took the tourist to a forest and tried to molest her.

44.title: Delhi experiences clear morning on Wednesday; air quality 'moderate'
44.article_body: Delhi experienced a sunny and clear morning on Wednesday, with the minimum temperature at 14.2 degrees, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The city's air quality fell into the 'moderate' category. The air quality index (AQI) read 149 at 8 am, according to the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR).

45.title: GST authorities expand probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe
45.article_body: GST authorities have expanded probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe to include reported issuance of fake invoices by those close to the firm's ousted Co-founder Ashneer Grover, PTI reported. Bharatpe's books are now being scrutinised to check if bogus invoices were issued for services too. Grover, his wife were stripped of their positions for indulgence in alleged financial irregularities.

46.title: TMC women legislators misbehaved with me in the Assembly: WB Guv
46.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday wrote to Speaker Biman Banerjee accusing TMC's women legislators of obstructing his movement and misbehaving with him. This comes after the Governor's address was cut short as BJP MLAs created a ruckus over alleged rigging in the civic polls. In the letter, Dhankhar asked Banerjee to meet and fix responsibility for the incident.

47.title: Thought of calling him but couldn't, was shattered after death: Saba on Irrfan
47.article_body: Actress Saba Qamar said she regrets not keeping in touch with her 'Hindi Medium' co-star and late actor Irrfan Khan's family. "When his health deteriorated...I kept thinking I will call him but...I couldn't. One day I heard about him...I was devastated and shattered," she said, adding, "I realised one should avail time they have, because that time never comes back."

48.title: No candidate forced to stay in resort before Goa poll result: Cong
48.article_body: Amid reports of Congress moving its candidates in Goa Assembly polls to a resort before poll results are announced, party leader Sunil Kauthankar said no one has been forced for it. "They voluntarily decided to stay together...Not correct to say that we are keeping a hold on our leaders because leaders have come from other states also," he added.

49.title: B'luru court rejects ED plea for proclamation order against Devas CEO
49.article_body: A special court in Bengaluru has rejected Enforcement Directorate's plea for a proclamation order against Ramachandran Vishwanathan, the CEO of Devas Multimedia. The ED had filed a money laundering case against Ramachandran following a failed 2005 satellite deal between Devas Multimedia and ISRO's commercial arm Antrix Corporation. Notably, a non-bailable warrant was issued against him last month.

50.title: Pic shows Japan's famous 'killing stone' split in half; sparks superstitions online
50.article_body: A picture of ancient rock called Sessho-seki (killing stone) located near the volcanic mountains in Japan's Nasu split into two has gone viral, sparking fear and superstitions on social media. Legend surrounding the stone states that it houses an evil spirit. "After nearly 1,000 years, the demon vixen is presumably once again on the loose," a Twitter user said.

51.title: My computer shut down while I was responding to client: Better.com worker on layoff
51.article_body: A Better.com employee named Amanda Bullard, speaking about the layoff wherein roughly 4,000 workers including her were sacked on Tuesday, shared her experience on LinkedIn. "I didn't find out through...payroll system, my bank account showing a severance check, or a phone call from HR. My computer just shut down in the middle of me responding to [a client]," she stated.

52.title: Canada will send Ukraine another shipment of military equipment: Trudeau
52.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Wednesday said that he told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a phone call that Canada will "send Ukraine another shipment of highly-specialized military equipment". Both leaders also discussed "sanctions against Russia and humanitarian assistance for Ukraine" during the call. Trudeau said that he has also invited Zelenskyy to address the Canadian Parliament.

53.title: Paytm Payments Bank may ask RBI for SFB licence by June: Report
53.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank is likely to apply to the RBI for a small finance bank (SFB) licence by June, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. "I think (the application for SFB licence will be moved) sometime around May-June next fiscal year," a source was quoted as saying. The bank had received a Scheduled Bank status from RBI last year.

54.title: Pune man cheated of ₹4.9 lakh by fraudster posing as bank employee
54.article_body: A 50-year-old man in Pune was cheated of ₹4.9 lakh by a fraudster posing as an employee of a nationalised bank. The accused allegedly called the victim and asked him to share a one-time password (OTP) on the pretext of helping the latter link his PAN card to his bank account. The man lost the money after sharing the OTP.

55.title: Soldier who had come home on leave goes missing from J&K's Budgam
55.article_body: A soldier of J&K Light Infantry regiment, who had come home on leave, went missing from his village in Kashmir's Budgam district. Police confirmed Sameer Malla has been missing since Monday afternoon when he went out to visit a neighbouring village. "We are looking for him," said Budgam SP, who did not rule out the possibility of Malla being abducted.

56.title: Ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian sent to 14-day judicial custody
56.article_body: Former NSE Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian has been sent to 14-day judicial custody by a CBI court in connection with the NSE co-location case. Subramanian is the "yogi" who guided the actions of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramakrishna, reports said quoting CBI sources. A Delhi court on Monday also granted seven-day custodial interrogation of Ramakrishna to the CBI.

57.title: Musk posts old meme linking Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi & Motorola to Bitcoin creator
57.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk shared an old meme speculating that Satoshi Nakamoto is derived from the names of Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi Corp and Motorola. Satoshi Nakamoto is the pseudonym of the developer of Bitcoin whose true identity is unknown. Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus joked, "The creator of Bitcoin is half Japanese, a quarter Korean and a quarter American."

58.title: Maybe after 5-10 yrs people will say we were one of the good teams: Ashwin
58.article_body: India's Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently became India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, has said he's looking to get better every day and enjoying this phase of his career. "I can see the kind of people I brushed shoulders with...Maybe 5-10 years down the line, people will talk about this being one of the good teams India has produced," he stated.

59.title: I used to bowl medium pace to become the next Kapil Dev: Ashwin
59.article_body: Having surpassed Kapil Dev's tally of 434 wickets in Tests to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "I used to bowl medium pace...so that I can...[become] the next Kapil paaji." "Even in my wildest dreams, I never thought of going past his tally. I always wanted to be a batsman especially when I started off," added Ashwin.

60.title: Centre plans to introduce regional languages in law courses
60.article_body: The Centre is planning to introduce regional languages as the medium of instruction in law courses in colleges across the country. UGC chairperson Jagadesh Kumar said, "Law is one area where our students will benefit if they study in regional languages." "We are discussing this with the vice-chancellors of national universities and other educational institutions," he added.

61.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman interacts with entrepreneurs in Bengaluru
61.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday interacted with leading entrepreneurs of IT/BT, Startups and Semiconductor sectors in Bengaluru, a press release said. Expressing her gladness over the Startup ecosystem of Karnataka, she said Karnataka sets an example to be emulated by others. She added, "We should make most of the economic opportunities that exist in the semiconductor sector."

62.title: Liquor sale banned in UP tomorrow in view of counting of votes
62.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Excise Department said on Wednesday that the sale and operations of liquor will be prohibited in the state tomorrow, March 10, in view of counting of votes. "Action to be taken in case of violation," it added. Separately, UP ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said 70,000 civil police workers will be deployed tomorrow.

63.title: EC orders action against Varanasi officer over EVMs' transportation
63.article_body: The Election Commission on Wednesday directed UP CEO to take action against Varanasi ADM NK Singh over the alleged violation of rules while transporting EVMs for training purposes. "UP CEO to proceed accordingly," EC said. On Tuesday, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged EVMs were being transported in Varanasi without the knowledge of candidates and claimed SP workers intercepted a truck.

64.title: Akhilesh speaks without logic: UP Minister on SP chief's EVM remark
64.article_body: Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) supremo Akhilesh Yadav's allegations of EVM tampering, Uttar Pradesh Minister Mohsin Raza said on Wednesday that Yadav's remarks lack logic. "It is sad to question the working of ECI. Indirectly, they (SP) are accepting their defeat by questioning the EVMs," Raza added. Yadav had alleged on Tuesday that EVMs were being stolen in Varanasi.

65.title: Brazilian club's mascot banned for 1 game for 'intimidatory' gesture
65.article_body: The mascot of Brazilian league champions Atletico Mineiro which is a man-sized chicken has been banned for one game, by the Minas Gerais state football federation due to "intimidatory" behaviour. The mascot ran to prevent one of the Cruzeiro players from celebrating in front of fans, during the derby match last weekend against Atletico Mineiro.

66.title: Bring special law against paper leaks or face mass protest: Hardik Patel
66.article_body: Gujarat Congress working president Hardik Patel on Wednesday demanded a special law against question paper leaks and threatened to launch a mass agitation in Gandhinagar on March 28 if the government doesn't act. "There have been paper leaks in over 20 government recruitment exams in the past few years," he said while asking the youth to join protest in Gandhinagar.

67.title: Thieves break into policeman's house in Maha, steal valuables worth ₹1 lakh
67.article_body: Unidentified men allegedly broke into a policeman's house in Sarda Nagari area of Maharashtra's Beed district and stole valuables worth ₹1.26 lakh, police said on Wednesday. According to police, Assistant Police Inspector (API) Ravindra Shinde's family had travelled to Beed city on March 4. However, on their return the family found that their house had been broken into, police added.

68.title: Size doesn't matter: Mahindra on China's defence budget being 3 times that of India
68.article_body: After China announced its 2022 defence budget of $230 billion, which is three times that of India's, businessman Anand Mahindra said, "Size doesn't matter. The future of warfare will be different." Ukraine's armed drones are playing havoc with convoys of tanks, he tweeted. "It's not how much we spend but how smartly we spend that will matter," Mahindra added.

69.title: Whenever Ranveer meets my parents, he tells them 'I'm proud of her': Deepika
69.article_body: Speaking about her husband-actor Ranveer Singh, actress Deepika Padukone said, "Ranveer is definitely my cheerleader...but it's not just on social media, it's at home, too, like when I try my hand...[in] cooking a meal." She added he's an emotional and sensitive person. "Even when he meets my parents, he always tells them how proud he is of me," she said.

70.title: 62-yr-old watchman beaten to death in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
70.article_body: A 62-year-old watchman was allegedly beaten to death in the premises of Girja Dayal College in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Tuesday. Police rushed to the college after his body lying in a pool of blood was found inside the premises. "The guard has been murdered by beating, an investigation is being done," police said.

71.title: Israel will pay for Syria attack that killed 2 Revolutionary Guards: Iran
71.article_body: Iran on Wednesday said that Israel "will pay the price" for the Syrian airstrike in which four people, including two Iranian Revolutionary Guards officers, were killed. According to the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, Monday's attack was the seventh Israeli strike on Syria this year, and the target was a weapon and ammunition depot near Damascus airport.

72.title: Live bat flies inside theatre during 'The Batman' screening in US, video goes viral
72.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a live bat flying inside a theatre in US during a screening of the movie 'The Batman'. Reacting to the video shared by a moviegoer, a user tweeted, "You sure you didn’t pay for the 3D version?" Another user wrote, "The bat deserves to watch the movie too."

73.title: Anmol & I got married in 2014; kept it a secret because of my career: Amrita
73.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband, radio jockey Anmol revealed in a new video that they tied the knot in a secret wedding in 2014. She said the wedding was kept a secret to make sure the news doesn't hamper her career. Amrita also revealed that they couldn't invite their cousins to the wedding because it was hidden from media.

74.title: People said 'Why would audiences see a pregnant woman in theatres?’: Vidya
74.article_body: Discussing her 2012 film 'Kahaani', actress Vidya Balan said, "[People] were like 'Why would audiences want to see a pregnant woman in theatres?'." "[Director] Sujoy Ghosh came to me with a script I didn't want to do but he [said]...he would keep coming...till I said yes," added Vidya. "I wasn't [willing to do] 'Kahaani'," stated her co-star Nawazuddin Siddiqui.

75.title: CAIT calls CCI 'spineless' for dropping probe against Amazon
75.article_body: CAIT has called the CCI "spineless" and "toothless" for dropping its investigation against Amazon. The investigation was looking into allegations that Amazon copied products of rival manufacturers and used its internal data to boost product lines. CAIT National President BC Bhartia and Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said it's highly unfortunate CCI has dropped such an investigation.

76.title: Ex-PM Raijv Gandhi’s assassination convict gets bail after 32 years in jail
76.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted bail to one of the convicts of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination. AG Perarivalan, who was sentenced to life imprisonment, has spent 32 years in jail. The court took into account Perarivalan's conduct in jail, his health and that he has spent more than 30 years in prison.

77.title: Pune police adds new member to K9 dog squad, seek a name for it
77.article_body: The Pune Police announced the arrival of a new member to their K9 dog unit's bomb detection squad on Wednesday and sought a name for the dog on Twitter. The new dog is from the Labrador retriever breed. The force has a sanctioned strength of nine dogs, of which four retired after completing their 10 years of service in February.

78.title: Don't remember the last time we saw match like 1st Pak-Aus Test: Inzamam
78.article_body: Criticising the wicket used in the Rawalpindi Test against Australia, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he doesn't even remember the last time when he saw a match like that. "You make turning pitch, help spinners. You utilize the home advantage, just don't make a dead pitch," he stated. "Even Australia adjusted really well to this pitch," Inzamam further said.

79.title: English batters are not ready to play Test cricket: Matt Prior
79.article_body: Discussing Day 1 of the opening Test between West Indies and England which saw England reduced to 48/4 at one point, ex-England wicketkeeper Matt Prior said the English batters aren't ready to play Tests. "Too many of them have some basic flaws," added Prior. Jonny Bairstow scored an unbeaten 109 to help England finish Day 1 on 268/6.

80.title: Bengal CM Mamata shares stage with Prashant Kishor amid rift rumours
80.article_body: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee shared stage with poll strategist Prashant Kishor and was seen interacting with him at a TMC meeting in Kolkata on Tuesday amid speculation of a rift. TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee was also present there. "There were certain reports of brewing differences between I-PAC and TMC. But nothing is static in politics," TMC leader Sudip Bandyopadhyay said.

81.title: Odisha college ex-principal held after assets worth more than ₹5 cr found
81.article_body: A former college principal of Biswanathpur's Hira Nila College was arrested in Odisha's Kalahandi district on Tuesday in a disproportionate assets case. This comes after Vigilance Directorate found assets worth more than ₹5 crore in his possession. The officials had conducted searches at five places on Monday. ₹1.94 lakh cash was recovered, among other things, from the accused.

82.title: My ex-boyfriend made me feel like sh*t; I was having sex with a gay man: Saisha
82.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', contestant Saisha Shinde spoke about the time she faced mental abuse in her past relationship. Saisha said, "He made me feel like I'm sh*t. He used to stand outside my door and...wait...that someone will come and I'll cheat." "I was a woman inside who was having sex with a gay man," Saisha added.

83.title: Mumbai Police bid final adieu to bomb squad dog with gun salute
83.article_body: A bomb squad dog named Simba passed away on Friday after serving Mumbai Police for nine years. The canine was given a state funeral at the veterinary hospital in Parel. "A Three Gun Salute For Our Best...You were the best companion and protector we could ever ask for," Mumbai Police tweeted while sharing a video of Simba's funeral.

84.title: Herzog becomes 1st Israeli leader to visit Turkey in 14 years
84.article_body: Israeli President Isaac Herzog is set to visit Turkey on Wednesday, becoming first Israeli leader to visit in 14 years, as both countries seek to normalise relations. Herzog is scheduled to hold talks with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in capital Ankara and also meet the Jewish community in Istanbul. Both countries had expelled their respective ambassadors in 2018.

85.title: Wrong window: Kajol to fan who asked when she'll work with SRK in Johar's film
85.article_body: Actress Kajol recently conducted an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram on the occasion of Women's Day. During the session, a user questioned Kajol when she would be seen in a Karan Johar movie with actor Shah Rukh Khan. Kajol responded, "That is Karan's pledge to take, wrong window, guys!"

86.title: Akhilesh should be put behind bars for spreading rumours about EVMs: BJP MP
86.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav should be put behind the bars for spreading rumours that the UP government is "stealing" EVMs, BJP Rajya Sabha MP, Harnath Singh Yadav, said. "According to the IPC, spreading rumours, misleading the public and giving wrong information come under the category of serious offences and Akhilesh Yadav is committing such crimes indiscriminately," Harnath added.

87.title: Over 75% youth in 15-18 age group received 1st COVID vaccine dose: Govt
87.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday said that over 75% of youth between the 15-18 age group have received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. He said, "Massive participation from Young India has significantly strengthened the world's largest vaccination drive." India has administered 5,55,80,872 first dose of COVID-19 vaccines in this age group as on Wednesday morning, data showed.

88.title: She'll come good soon: Jhulan on Shafali getting out for 2 ducks in last 3 ODIs
88.article_body: India Women pacer Jhulan Goswami has backed 18-year-old batter Shafali Verma, who has registered two ducks in her last three ODI innings, to do well in upcoming matches. "Shafali is batting well in the nets, she is hitting the ball really well. She is just one big knock away…I am sure she is going to do well," added Jhulan.

89.title: Even mild COVID-19 can cause brain to shrink: Oxford University study
89.article_body: COVID-19 can cause the brain to shrink up to 2%, reduce grey matter in regions controlling emotion and memory, and damage areas controlling the sense of smell, an Oxford University study has found. The scientists said the effects were even seen in people who had mild COVID-19. Whether the impact can be partially reversed or not needs more investigation.

90.title: Sanctions on Russia unlikely to affect our defence sector: NITI Aayog member
90.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine are unlikely to affect India's defence imports, NITI Aayog member VK Saraswat said on Wednesday. He added that Russia possesses inherent military strength and is self-sufficient in military equipment manufacturing. "The reserve is very high. These kinds of short-term sanctions are not likely to create any problems for India," he said.

91.title: Flipping wrong switch caused Taiwan outage, not hackers: Govt report
91.article_body: An operator at the Hsinta coal-fired power plant in Kaohsiung in Taiwan flipped a switch marked 'Do Not Operate' that eventually led to blackouts across multiple regions, including the capital Taipei, a government investigation found. It was earlier speculated that the island's grid had been targeted in a cyberattack.The outage hit around 55 lakh homes.

92.title: Had said no to 'Jalsa', didn't have guts; COVID changed something: Vidya
92.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan who will be seen in 'Jalsa', said she had refused to do the movie and that she did not have "guts to do it". "Then one day when Suresh [Triveni] told me...he reworked script, I said I'd like to hear it again...I read and I was like, 'I am on'," the 'Shaadi Ke Side Effects' actress said.

93.title: Tick saliva drugs can replace painkillers, ease itching in people: Study
93.article_body: Votucalis, a protein found in tick saliva, can be used to make a drug that can replace painkillers and ease itching in people, as per research published in Frontiers in Pharmacology journal. The saliva of brown-ear tick, Rhipicephalus appendiculatus, contains protein that binds with histamine, preventing it from activating cell surface receptors, thereby reducing itching or chronic pain responses.

94.title: SC extends interim relief to ex-Mumbai Police chief Param Bir Singh
94.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the interim protection from the arrest granted to ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh in a case related to the allegation of misconduct and corruption. The bench of Justices SK Kaul and MM Sundresh said that the interim order will continue till March 24.

95.title: How are EVMs taken to strong rooms after polling & secured before counting?
95.article_body: After polling at booths, presiding officers prepare an account of votes recorded in the electronic voting machines and give attested copies to each candidate's polling agent. EVMs are then sealed and candidates travel behind vehicles carrying EVMs to strong rooms. The strong rooms are sealed and can't be opened until the morning of counting day, with security forces deployed there.

96.title: Not trying to overthrow Ukraine government: Russia
96.article_body: Amid its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has said that it is not trying to overthrow the country's government. Russia further said that "some progress" is being made in talks with Ukraine. Last month, a senior official of US Department of Defence had said that Russia has "every intention" of overthrowing the Ukrainian government.

97.title: Hardeep Puri inaugurates 3 community centres in Delhi's Rohini
97.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday inaugurated three air-conditioned community centres in Rohini Sector 7, 8 and 15 in Delhi. "The hard work of BJP MLAs, MPs and Councillors is ushering an era of inclusive development in Delhi," Puri tweeted. "The politics of laying foundation stones...replaced by the policy of completing projects on time and within budgets," he added.

98.title: Fire at B'desh Rohingya camp kills 6-yr-old boy, leaves 2,000 homeless
98.article_body: A six-year-old boy has been killed and about 2,000 people have been left homeless following a fire at a Kutupalong refugee camp in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh, on Tuesday, authorities said. This is reportedly the sixth fire this year to hit the world's biggest refugee camp. A massive fire in January had destroyed 1,200 shelters and left over 5,000 people homeless.

99.title: UP polls last chance for people to save democracy: Akhilesh Yadav
99.article_body: Ahead of the UP Assembly polls results, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the state elections are the "last chance to save democracy" and after this people will have to "launch a movement" to bring change. He also alleged EVM tampering in the state and said "we may go to court". "We need to save our votes," he added.

100.title: Tiger kills man in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni; body found in pieces
100.article_body: A tiger killed a man who had gone to graze his cattle in a forest in the Seoni district of Madhya Pradesh, a forest official said on Wednesday. Following the incident, the local residents found a few pieces of his body in the forest. Proceedings were being made to provide financial assistance to the deceased's relatives, the forest official added.

101.title: DTC bus depot to be constructed in Savda Ghevra resettlement colony
101.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to construct a DTC bus depot in Savda Ghevra resettlement colony to boost connectivity with central and east Delhi areas. "Once this depot will be ready, 200 buses will start from this resettlement colony," a senior transport official said. The Public Works Department (PWD) has issued tenders for the construction of the depot.

102.title: Webcast vote counting process, share link with parties: SP to EC
102.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes for recently-concluded UP Assembly polls on Thursday, Samajwadi Party wrote to the Chief Election Commissioner demanding webcasting of the counting process in all constituencies. SP demanded that the link must be shared with all political parties. Earlier, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had alleged that EVMs were being transported without parties' knowledge in UP.

103.title: 5 minor girls raped & forced into flesh trade in Mumbai, man booked
103.article_body: A 50-year-old man was booked for allegedly raping five minor girls, four of whom are sisters, and forcing them into flesh trade in Mumbai. The incident came to light after a 17-year-old girl, who was rescued from a brothel two years ago, spoke about it. The crime happened from 2018-21 in Chembur. Police said the accused will be arrested soon.

104.title: Ex-Goldman banker faked ex-wife's email account to lie to girlfriend
104.article_body: Former Goldman Sachs banker Tim Leissner has detailed how he used his ex-wife's email to lie to his former girlfriend, Kimora Lee Simmons. Leissner, a key witness against former Goldman banker Roger Ng in the 1MDB scandal, posed as Judy Chan to convince Simmons the two were no longer married. Leissner was questioned about the phoney account by Ng's lawyer.

105.title: Latest rankings for Test batters out, Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma
105.article_body: The ICC today announced the latest rankings for Test batters, with former India captain Virat Kohli overtaking India captain Rohit Sharma. Virat Kohli jumped two spots to be ranked fifth, while Rohit Sharma dropped a place to be ranked sixth. Rishabh Pant moved into the top 10 after jumping one spot.

106.title: Don't rush: TMC to Meghalaya CM Sangma on border pact with Assam
106.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) asked Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma not to rush into a border pact with Assam. "I'd like to appeal to the government to hold on, have a more exhaustive understanding about this...issue," TMC's Mukul Sangma said. This comes after Conrad Sangma said that 30 of the 36 disputed villages along the Meghalaya-Assam border will remain in Meghalaya.

107.title: Sensex ends 1,223 points higher at 54,647 ahead of assembly poll results
107.article_body: The Sensex ended 1,223 points or over 2% higher at 54,647 on Wednesday, a day ahead of five state assembly election results. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped 332 points or 2% to close at 16,345. The benchmark indices ended in the green for the second straight day. Reliance Industries, Asian Paints, Bajaj Finance were among top Sensex gainers.

108.title: 'Is she man or woman': Kerala tribal activist alleges verbal abuse on train
108.article_body: Malayali tribal activist Dayabai has alleged that she faced verbal abuse by her co-passengers on a train from Ernakulam to Rajkot. Dayabai reportedly heard a co-passenger, talking on the phone, say, "Look at her face, is she a man or a woman?" When she complained about too much noise in the train, the co-passengers said she should have taken flight.

109.title: India is one of those countries which will decide fate of this century: Ukrainian MP
109.article_body: Ukraine's youngest MP Sviatoslav Yurash said India is one of those countries which will decide fate of this century. "As far as Indian position on Russian relationship is concerned, we're thankful for the call PM Modi made to our President. We're thankful for humanitarian steps India...has been making," he added. Sviatoslav further said "Russia needs to be punished by India".

110.title: Karnataka's Shobha Gasti, Nivruti Rai honoured by President Kovind
110.article_body: On International Women's Day, President Ram Nath Kovind presented Nari Shakti Puraskar to Shobha Gasti and Nivruti Rai from Karnataka along with 29 other women for their contribution in various fields. While Gasti was honoured for her work towards women and girls' empowerment, Nivruti Rai, Country Head, Intel India, was honoured for her outstanding contribution in the field of technology.

111.title: Hyd may see traffic curbs during Assembly session from March 9-15
111.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued an advisory in view of the ongoing Telangana Legislative Assembly session. The police said that traffic may be stopped or diverted from March 9 to March 15 in some routes. The areas where traffic congestion is likely include Telugu Thalli – Iqbal Minar – Ravindra Bharathi route.

112.title: 1 killed, 13 injured in explosion in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur
112.article_body: At least one person was killed and 13 others were injured following an explosion near the Tehsildar office in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur on Wednesday. "Exact cause...of the blast being worked out...too early to draw any definite conclusion," BJP leader Dr Jitendra Singh said. "Injured being moved to hospital. I'm in touch with DC Smt Indu Chib," he tweeted.

113.title: Noida woman jumps to death from 26th floor as she failed to clear UPSC
113.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after jumping from the 26th floor of a building in Noida. Police said the woman, who'd previously worked at State Bank of India, had quit her job to prepare for the UPSC exam. However, she reportedly failed to clear it and became depressed, police added. Her mother was at home when this happened.

114.title: Land unavailable for making parking space for vehicles: Pune Metro
114.article_body: After commuters complained of parking issues near the newly operational Pune Metro, MahaMetro, which is implementing the project, said that land for making parking space for vehicles is not available. "There is a paucity of land along the Pune-Mumbai highway for developing parking space," its spokesperson said. He added, "If we get the land, we will set up parking lots."

115.title: Cabinet approves SPV for sale of surplus govt land and buildings
115.article_body: The Union Cabinet has approved setting up of the National Land Monetisation Corporation (NLMC), a special purpose vehicle (SPV) to handle the sale of surplus government land and buildings. NLMC's board will include senior central government officers and eminent experts. In addition to selling surplus land and buildings, NLMC will own and manage surplus assets of central PSUs under closure.

116.title: Musk seeks to end SEC deal requiring his tweets to be pre-approved
116.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has asked a federal judge to terminate his 2018 agreement with the US SEC requiring some of his tweets to be vetted by a lawyer. "The SEC's pursuit...has crossed the line into harassment, which is quintessential bad faith," lawyers said. The decree was signed in 2018 after Musk's "funding secured" tweet on taking Tesla private.

117.title: Mumbai Police detains Fadnavis over protest demanding Nawab's resignation
117.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and senior BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis was detained by Mumbai Police for allegedly participating in a protest demanding NCP leader and Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's resignation. Malik was arrested by ED over an alleged money laundering case linked to underworld don Dawood Ibrahim. Fadnavis was seen clenching his fist while he was being taken away by police.

118.title: Ravindra Jadeja becomes world number one all-rounder in Test cricket
118.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has become the world number one all-rounder in Test cricket after jumping two spots in the latest ICC rankings. This comes after Jadeja scored 175*(228) and took nine wickets in the first Test against Sri Lanka. Jadeja is on top with 406 rating points. Ravichandran Ashwin is ranked third.

119.title: Ukraine's air defences having success against Russian jets: UK
119.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry on Wednesday said Ukraine's air defences have "enjoyed considerable success against Russia's modern combat aircraft". This has likely prevented Moscow from achieving "any degree of control of the air", it added. According to UK's Defence Intelligence report, fighting in Kyiv's northwest region is ongoing but Russian forces have failed to make "any significant breakthroughs".

120.title: SAT declines to stay SEBI order directing Dish TV to disclose AGM results
120.article_body: Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has declined to stay SEBI's order directing Dish TV to disclose voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM). SAT has also directed Dish TV to file its reply in the matter against SEBI's order by March 20.  SEBI passed the order after receiving complaints from Yes Bank and other Dish TV shareholders.

121.title: Small Ukrainian boy cries as he walks to Poland border; video surfaces
121.article_body: A video of a small Ukrainian boy crying while walking to Poland border amid war is being widely shared online. The video shows the boy dragging his belongings in a bag while crying loudly. While the child appears to be alone in the video, reports claimed he was walking behind his mother.

122.title: Partnership in middle crucial: Bairstow on ton after Eng were 48/4 vs WI
122.article_body: England batter Jonny Bairstow, who is currently unbeaten at 109, has said partnerships through the middle of their innings on Day 1 in the ongoing Test against West Indies were crucial. England were 48/4 when Bairstow came in to bat and added 67 runs with Ben Stokes for the fifth wicket. He then added 99 runs with Ben Foakes.

123.title: PMC to start classes for 1st batch of MBBS at new medical college
123.article_body: After receiving approval from National Medical Commission(NMC), Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to start classes for first batch of 100 MBBS students at its new medical college. The Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College will commence classes from December this year, PMC Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said. The college will be under Maharashtra University of Health Sciences, Nashik.

124.title: I wanted to spend money on my body after being skin-shamed: Tejasswi
124.article_body: Speaking about dealing with body-shaming, actress Tejasswi Prakash said she used to feel bad at that time. She added, "I was...receiving negative comments because I was underweight." Tejasswi added she wanted to spend money on her body after she was called out for being skinny. "It was...tempting but then I told myself...if I...change myself, I'm no different," she added.

125.title: 35 MP natives stuck at Ukraine's Sumy likely to return tonight: State govt
125.article_body: Nearly 35 natives of Madhya Pradesh stuck in Ukraine's Sumy city have left the country and are likely to reach India by tonight, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. "All are safe...and...in touch with their family members," Mishra added. The MP government had announced that it will arrange for stay, food and transportation of students returning from Ukraine.

126.title: China to send humanitarian aid worth 5 million yuan to Ukraine
126.article_body: The Chinese Red Cross will send humanitarian assistance worth 5 million yuan (over ₹6 crore) to Ukraine, said the Chinese foreign ministry on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, which has resulted in lakhs of Ukrainians fleeing the country. The country is also facing shortage of food, water and electricity.

127.title: Father, his sons arrested for kidnapping student, demanding ₹7 lakh in B'luru
127.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a father, his sons for allegedly abducting a 21-year-old student from his residence and demanding a ransom of ₹7 lakh. The kidnappers earlier used to be neighbours of the student and were aware that his mother had received a share of his father's ancestral property after his death, which was sold last year, the police said.

128.title: Pune govt hospital superintendent demands bribe from pvt doctor, held
128.article_body: The medical superintendent of a sub-district hospital in Bhor taluka in Pune district has been booked for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10,000 from a private doctor. The 60-year-old accused had demanded the bribe for not giving a negative report about the sonography centre in the hospital run by the doctor. The accused was nabbed while accepting ₹5,000 on Tuesday.

129.title: US man caught smuggling 52 lizards, snakes in packets hidden in his clothes
129.article_body: A 30-year-old man from the US was caught trying to smuggle as many as 52 reptiles including 43 horned lizards and nine snakes at a border crossing with Mexico. According to customs officials, the man, who was driving a truck, kept the reptiles tied up in small bags which were hidden in his jacket, pants pockets and groin area.

130.title: Mumbai court sentences man to 5-yr-jail for daughter-in-law's suicide
130.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced an 82-year-old man to five years of rigorous imprisonment for allegedly abetting the suicide of his daughter-in-law 11 years ago. The court noted that he repeatedly abused her in a drunken state and threatened to kill her. "It is not expected by any daughter-in-law that she would be given such inhuman treatment," it added.

131.title: Australian Army Chief pays respects at National War Memorial in Delhi
131.article_body: Chief of Australian Army, Lieutenant General Rick Burr, paid his respects to the martyred Indian soldiers and laid a wreath at the National War Memorial in Delhi on Wednesday. Burr, who is on a two-day visit to India, was received by the Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane. He was also given a Guard of Honour at the South Block.

132.title: Pics of crowds at Soviet Union's 1st McDonald's surface as firm shuts Russian shops
132.article_body: Pictures showing long queues outside Soviet Union's first McDonald's on its opening day surfaced online after the company temporarily shut restaurants in Russia. The first McDonald's opened in Moscow's Pushkin Square in 1990, symbolising the opening of USSR to the West. "I stood in line for...an hour to get a cheeseburger in 1990...It's a sad day," a Twitter user said.

133.title: ICC announces Player of the Month nominations for February, 3 Indians included
133.article_body: ICC has announced Player of the Month nominations for February, with three Indians included across the two categories. Shreyas Iyer, who won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten fifties against Sri Lanka in T20Is, has been nominated in men's category, while Mithali Raj and Deepti Sharma have been nominated for ICC Women's Player of the Month award.

134.title: National agencies get trained by BJP, fabricate cases: Raut
134.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said national agencies like NCB, CBI and ED get trained by BJP and fabricate cases, not Maharashtra Police. "False cases are never filed against anybody in Maharashtra," he added. Referring to Ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' claims that Maharashtra government is working to frame BJP leaders, Raut said, "His sensational remarks are maligning state police."

135.title: Global carbon dioxide emissions reach highest level in history: Experts
135.article_body: The global emission of carbon dioxide (CO2) has reached its highest levels in history, experts said. CO2 emissions rose by 6% in 2021 to 36.3 billion metric tons, a report stated. During pandemic, carbon emission declined due to lesser consumption of fossil fuels but as the world economy rebounded post-COVID with heavy reliance on fossil fuels, CO2 emissions surged massively.

136.title: Russia claims Ukraine was planning to attack Donbass in March, shares 'secret' document
136.article_body: Russian foreign ministry shared a 'secret' document it allegedly acquired during special military operation in Ukraine. "Classified documents (order by Commander National Guard of Ukraine) confirm...Kiev regime was covertly preparing an offensive operation against Donbass [in] March 2022," it wrote. Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists have been fighting in Donbass since 2014.

137.title: Why did US reject Poland's offer to provide its MiG-29 jets to Ukraine?
137.article_body: The US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its MiG-29 jets to a base in Germany to be provided to Ukraine in the war against Russia. The Pentagon said the prospect of flying combat aircraft from NATO territory into the war zone "raises serious concerns for the entire NATO alliance". NATO has said it does not want direct conflict with Russia.

138.title: More military at India & China borders increases risk of armed confrontation: US
138.article_body: The annual threat assessment of the US Intelligence Community stated that expanded military posture by both India and China along the disputed border elevates the risk of armed confrontation between two nuclear powers. It added that this "might involve direct threats to US persons and interests and calls for US intervention." It also said that Indo-China relations will remain strained.

139.title: Next generation bowlers can forget about 1000 int'l wickets: Ashwin on Warne
139.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that the next generation of bowlers can forget about getting 1000+ international wickets, a record held by Shane Warne, who passed away last week, and Muttiah Muralitharan. "[Because] the volume of Test cricket will come down drastically. And also because there are so many leagues, workload management will take centre-stage," Ashwin explained.

140.title: Girl who sells balloons in Kerala turns model, makeover pics go viral
140.article_body: A balloon seller from Kerala has gone viral after photos of her makeover were posted online. The girl named Kisbu was selling balloons near a temple when she was spotted by photographer Arjun Krishnan, who took a few pictures of the teenager, one of which he posted on Instagram. It went viral and led to Kisbu starring in a photoshoot.

141.title: No 4th COVID wave in India unless a differently-behaving variant comes up: Virologist
141.article_body: Virologist Dr T Jacob John has said he is "fairly confident" that no fourth COVID-19 wave will occur in India unless an unexpected variant that behaves differently comes up. John, the former director of Indian Council for Medical Research's Centre of Advanced Research in Virology, said it can be confidently concluded that the third COVID-19 wave has ended.

142.title: Bumble removes all its dating apps from Russia & Belarus
142.article_body: Bumble is discontinuing its operations in Russia and removing all of its dating apps from Apple App Store and Google Play Store in Russia and Belarus. Bumble expects losing about $20 million in revenue in 2022 from this move. The combined revenue from Russia, Ukraine and Belarus was approximately 2.8% of its total revenue in 2021, mostly from Badoo app.

143.title: Bengaluru police shoot 2 murder accused in leg after they attack police
143.article_body: Bengaluru police on Wednesday allegedly opened fire to arrest two people wanted in a murder case. Reportedly, the men were on a two-wheeler and upon being confronted by the police, they attacked the policemen. Police, in order to defend themselves and arrest the culprits, then fired rounds at their legs to immobilise them, Times Now reported.

144.title: Pune court denies bail to medical student in ₹10-lakh extortion case
144.article_body: A Pune court on Monday denied bail to a medical student who was arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from an engineering student. The accused, Amar Suryakant Poul, had allegedly sought money on pretext of establishing a media office and threatened to kill the victim if he didn't comply. Notably, Poul also has other cases of cheating registered against him.

145.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on day-long evacuation corridors
145.article_body: A Ukrainian official has said that Russia and Ukraine have agreed on day-long evacuation corridors to help civilians escape the war. Thousands are thought to have died or been wounded amid the biggest attack on a European state since World War II. Earlier, at least 10 people were killed in a Russian military attack in Severodonestk.

146.title: Poland offers to place its MiG-29 jets at US disposal to be provided to Ukraine
146.article_body: Poland has said that it is ready to deploy its MiG-29 jets to Ramstein Air Base in Germany and put them at US disposal for them to be provided to Ukraine. "Poland requests the US to provide us with used aircraft with corresponding operational capabilities. Poland is ready to immediately establish the conditions of purchase of the planes," it said.

147.title: Raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic: BJP to Akhilesh Yadav
147.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claims of EVM tampering, the BJP said that raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic. "Akhilesh Yadav ji raising questions on EVMs is not only ridiculous but also anti-democratic. Did BJP question EVMs after defeat in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan etc.?," BJP's Arvind Menon said. "Poor EVMs, they have to bear the brunt of Dynasts," BJP's CT Ravi said.

148.title: IPO-bound Mobikwik posts 1st-ever profit of ₹7 cr in Dec quarter
148.article_body: IPO-bound fintech firm Mobikwik recorded its first-ever profit of ₹7 crore in the December 2021 quarter after losing money in the first and second quarters. The company had achieved revenue of around ₹400 crore in the nine-month period ended December 31, an 86% growth on a year-on-year basis. It expects its full financial year of 2022-23 to be profitable.

149.title: I didn't know much English: Sushmita recalls answering Miss Universe question
149.article_body: Sushmita Sen recalled the question that led to her winning the 1994 Miss Universe pageant. Sushmita was asked, "What for you is the essence of being a woman?" In a recent interview, Sushmita revealed she was from Hindi medium school and didn't know much English at that time. "I don't know how...I answered that question with such clarity," she added.

150.title: Saw them painting faces, they broke with pain in time: Bhansali on sex workers
150.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, while speaking to actress Alia Bhatt in an interview recalled how he saw sex workers during his childhood. "I saw them painting their faces and I saw their faces broken in time with pain. They were trying to look beautiful but looked uglier and uglier because it was distortion," Bhansali said.

151.title: Telangana govt to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies: CM KCR
151.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday announced the state government's decision to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies in the state. "The services of 11,103 contract employees working against direct recruitment vacancies will be regularised," he said. "The recruitment process for the remaining vacancies of 80,039 would be taken up immediately," Rao further said.

152.title: UP policeman congratulates BJP leader before poll results, probe ordered
152.article_body: A probe has been ordered against a policeman in Uttar Pradesh after he was seen congratulating BJP state vice-president Dayashankar Singh on becoming a cabinet minister ahead of the poll results in a video. A transfer order has also been issued for the policeman. The counting of votes of the 2022 UP Assembly elections is scheduled for March 10.

153.title: Sehwag congratulates Ashwin over 'mankading' rule change, says 'Ek karna zaroor'
153.article_body: Ex-cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to congratulate Ravichandran Ashwin after MCC removed 'mankading' from 'Unfair play' to 'Run-out' section in its laws. "Congratulations Ashwin, great week this one. First becoming second-highest [Test] wicket-taker for India...and now this. Ab full freedom to plot such run-outs with Buttler. Ek karna zaroor." Ashwin had 'mankaded' Buttler in IPL 2019.

154.title: No-confidence motion submitted against Pakistan PM to remove him from office
154.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have submitted a no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan to remove him from office after holding his government responsible for the uncontrolled inflation. The motion was signed by about 100 lawmakers. Last year, Khan got 178 votes when he had decided to seek a vote of confidence after a candidate supported by his party lost Senate election.

155.title: I put on a lot of weight; was shocked to see those pics myself: Fardeen
155.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan said people were shocked to see his pictures after he put on weight. "It wasn't that I was living in denial...I was...shocked when I saw those pictures myself," he added. "You can either let it work for you or let it destroy you. I'm not one of those who sits and wallows in self-pity," Fardeen said.

156.title: Millions of children trembling at every sound: Ukrainian model Veronika
156.article_body: Talking about the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Ukrainian model Veronika Didusenko said, "Millions of Ukrainian children..., their mothers are trembling at every sound...and...more heartbreaking are those forced to give birth." "Directly above my head, dozens of...helicopters...were bombing an...airfield," added Veronika. "Cities...are on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe," stated the model.

157.title: 3 killed after being trapped in coal mine in Telangana’s Peddapalli
157.article_body: Three people were found dead after being trapped following an accident in Singareni Collieries in Telangana's Peddapalli district, the officials said on Wednesday. The incident occurred on Monday afternoon when a portion of the roof or the side wall of the mine collapsed. Among the dead, two were company officials while one was an outsourced worker.

158.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹20,000 while trying to order wine online
158.article_body: A 24-year-old Mumbai-based woman was duped of ₹20,406 by a cyber fraudster in a wine shop-cum-Google listing fraud. According to the complainant's statement, she had ordered wine from the 'Wine and Wine' shop after looking up their number on Google. A man received the call and sent her QR codes to make the payment after which the amount was deducted.

159.title: Chhattisgarh’s GSDP estimated to grow by 11.5%, says economic survey
159.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP) is estimated to grow by 11.54% and the per capita income by 11.93% in the financial year 2021-22, according to the economic survey presented by the state government in the Legislative Assembly on Tuesday. The survey report was presented by Planning, Economics and Statistics Minister Amarjeet Bhagat.

160.title: What are the major announcements made in Chhattisgarh Budget 2022-23?
160.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Wednesday announced that the old pension scheme will be restored. "₹2 crore proposed for Chhattisgarh Rojgar Mission to work on the possibilities of creating new jobs," Baghel added. Chhattisgarh government has increased the annual assistance under Rajiv Gandhi Bhumihin Krishi Majdur Nyay Yojana from ₹6,000 to ₹7,000 from next year.

161.title: Antarctic explorer's ship found 107 years after it sank
161.article_body: The wreck of Endurance, the lost ship of Antarctic explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton, was found at the weekend at the bottom of the Weddell Sea. The ship was crushed by sea-ice and sank in 1915, forcing Shackleton and his men to escape on foot and in small boats. Its name - Endurance - is clearly visible on the stern.

162.title: CM Baghel brings briefcase made of cow dung to present Chhattisgarh Budget, shares pic
162.article_body: Chattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel walked in the Chhattisgarh Assembly carrying a briefcase made of cow dung ahead of the state Budget. The briefcase had "Gomaye Vasate Lakshmi" written on it in Sanskrit, which translates to "Goddess of wealth Laxmi resides in cow dung". Chhattisgarh government had announced in 2020 that it'll procure cow dung from cow breeders and farmers.

163.title: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump as ban on international flights lifted after 2 years
163.article_body: Shares of Indian airlines, including SpiceJet, IndiGo parent InterGlobe Aviation and Jet Airways, rose 5-8% each, a day after the government lifted the ban on regular international flights after two years. The Centre will resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27. Currently, international flights operate under air bubble arrangements with nations.

164.title: Security measures in place at EVM strong room: Lucknow Police Commissioner
164.article_body: There are adequate security measures in place at EVM strong room, DK Thakur, Police Commissioner, Lucknow, said on Wednesday. "Strong room will be opened at around 7 am in the presence of election observers and candidates. Counting (of votes) will begin at 8 am tomorrow. Police patrolling will be done in sensitive areas," Thakur added.

165.title: Better.com accidentally sent severance cheques a day before mass layoffs: Report
165.article_body: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com accidentally released severance payslips a day before mass layoffs were meant to be announced, TechCrunch reported citing employees. "No email, no call, nothing. This was handled disgustingly," an employee, who received a severance cheque, said. After the mistake, CFO Kevin Ryan sent an email to employees confirming the layoffs in US and India.

166.title: Not snorting drugs, leave if uncomfortable: Shweta on breastfeeding in public
166.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari said that as a mother, she enjoys breastfeeding and that if doing it in public makes anyone uncomfortable, they can "get up and go". "I'm not doing anything wrong. I'm not snorting drugs. I am feeding my hungry child," she said, adding, "It's such a taboo, airports don't have breastfeeding areas. They have smoking areas, though."

167.title: Alia in 'Gangubai...' in same league as Nargis in 'Mother India': Bhansali
167.article_body: Discussing actress Alia Bhatt's performance in his film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he believes it is in the "same league" as late actress Nargis Dutt's performance in classic 'Mother India'. "[The] performance...will be celebrated for the next 50-100 years," added Bhansali. "It could be at par with...Meena Kumari in 'Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam'," stated Bhansali.

168.title: I will give prize money for rest of 2022 to victims in Ukraine: Murray
168.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray tweeted that he will be donating his earnings from prize money for the rest of 2022, to victims of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "Over 7.5 million children are at risk with the escalating conflict in Ukraine," added Murray in his tweet. "It is vital [that] education continues," stated the tennis player.

169.title: Not really happy with my performance in Ranji, 40s and 50s are nothing: Shaw
169.article_body: Indian batter Prithvi Shaw, who's leading Mumbai in the Ranji Trophy 2022, has said he's not happy with his performance in the tournament. "It should have been much better. You know 40s and 50s are nothing in cricket," he stated. Shaw produced scores of 1, 9, 44 and 53 in his four innings in three Ranji games.

170.title: 2,078 UP students stranded in Ukraine evacuated: CM Yogi Adityanath
170.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that out of the total of 2,290 students from UP studying in Ukraine, 2,078 have been safely evacuated and have returned to their respective homes. He further informed that out of 74 students from Gorakhpur, 70 have safely returned. "The rest of the students are also being brought back safely," the CM added.

171.title: IIT grads-led Money View raises $75 mn at $625 mn valuation
171.article_body: Fintech platform Money View has raised $75 million in its Series D funding from Tiger Global, Winter Capital, Evolvence India and Accel, among others. The startup is now valued at $625 million. Founded in 2014 by IIT Delhi graduates, Puneet Agarwal and Sanjay Aggarwal, Money View provides personal loans, as well as buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) products to individuals.

172.title: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day ahead of 5 state assembly election results
172.article_body: The Sensex jumped over 1,100 points during intraday trade on Wednesday ahead of the five state assembly election results tomorrow. While the Sensex was trading above 54,500 levels, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 300 points to trade above 16,300 levels. Earlier, exit polls predicted that AAP may win in Punjab, while BJP will retain Uttar Pradesh.

173.title: 6 labourers from Bihar drugged, robbed on train in UP
