347.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said the Mumbai Police were investigating extortion charges against four Enforcement Directorate officers, adding that "some of them will go to jail". He said, "ED and some of its officials have become...ATM for...BJP." His remarks come on a day when Income Tax department conducted raids on premises linked to Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray's aide.

348.title: TMC could've done better if we had more time: Mamata on Goa polls
348.article_body: Ahead of Goa Assembly poll results, Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo Mamata Banerjee said on Tuesday that party could've done better if it had more time. "I'm happy that we were able to reach out to every family in Goa with our logo [but]...We...started late," she added. TMC had previously said it's open to post-poll alliance with like-minded parties in Goa.

349.title: Ukraine war may have limited impact on domestic credit market: Report
349.article_body: An India Ratings and Research (IRR) report said Russia-Ukraine war's impact on the domestic credit market may be limited as the banking system has adequate liquidity. The duration and intensity of the war will be the key determinant for the macro and micro risks. Entities with a weak financial profile may face financing challenges if the situation worsens, it added.

350.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi plastic factory, 100 firefighters deployed
350.article_body: A fire broke out at a plastic factory in Delhi's Bawana area on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the fire broke out at 6:30 am when 50 workers were present inside. Delhi Fire Service said they deployed 25 fire tenders and 100 firefighters to the spot. Officials said they also used a drone in the firefighting operation.

351.title: House of suspect raided by NIA in Pune's Kondhwa over ISKP case
351.article_body: A suspect's house was raided by the NIA in connection with a case of planning terrorist attacks in India. Officials said searches were conducted at 38-year-old Talha Khan's residence in Kondhwa, Pune, on Monday over propagating terrorist group ISIS' ideology as part of outlawed Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISKP) activities. Various incriminating documents and digital devices were seized.

352.title: My life is guided by women: Shahid on mother Neliima and wife Mira
352.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and posted a picture of his mother Neliima Azeem and wife Mira Kapoor. "These two are enough for me to know how much...my life is guided, supported...by women," Shahid captioned his post. "Here's to every woman...You all make this world a much better place," he added.

353.title: CBFC passes 'The Kashmir Files' with 7 cuts & 'A' certificate
353.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) passed 'The Kashmir Files' with an 'A' certificate. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, was approved by the board with seven cuts and words like 'Hindu' and 'Pandit' were removed when they were associated with cuss words. The board even changed the name of the university from JNU to ANU in the film.

354.title: Trafficked woman reunited with family in Arunachal after 12 years
354.article_body: A trafficked woman was reunited with her biological family in Arunachal Pradesh after 12 years on March 7. Arunachal Women Helpline (WHL-181), which had received information about a survivor of child trafficking and domestic violence, facilitated her return. According to the woman's statement, she was just eight years old when her stepmother sold her to a person in Assam.

355.title: Haryana announces ₹5 lakh award named after Sushma Swaraj
355.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on the occasion of the International Women's Day on Tuesday announced an award named after late BJP leader Sushma Swaraj. A sum of ₹5 lakh will be given to women from Haryana who have made significant contributions. He also announced Haryana Matrushakti Udyamita Scheme to support women in becoming entrepreneurs.

356.title: Scindia carries small girl to her mother in evacuation flight, helps them with seats
356.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, who was in Romania to expedite evacuation of Indian nationals through Operation Ganga, was seen helping an Indian family with their seats in a flight. A video shows Scindia carrying a small girl to where her mother was seated in the flight after asking a passenger to swap her seat with that of the girl.

357.title: Google to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant for $5.4 billion
357.article_body: Google on Tuesday said it would buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant at $23/share in an all-cash deal for approximately $5.4 billion. Google's offer represents a premium of about 57% to Mandiant's stock price before a report said Microsoft was planning to buy the firm. "Google Cloud shares our mission-driven culture to bring security to every organization,” said Mandiant CEO Kevin Mandia.

358.title: 2 held in Delhi for credit card fraud; 17 sim cards, 2 laptops found
358.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Delhi's Najafgarh area for allegedly cheating people in the guise of redemption of credit card points, the police said. According to the complainant, his credit card was used for three transactions worth ₹44,000 and the money was transferred to a wallet and a shopping website. Police recovered seven mobile phones, 17 SIM cards, two laptops.

359.title: Fake claims of Russia-Ukraine war being a hoax go viral
359.article_body: Theories claiming the Russia-Ukraine war is a hoax have gone viral. Some social media users claimed actors are being used to act out scenes from an attack. One such claim is in the form of a video, which shows people getting fake blood applied. The video, however, shows the preparation of a scene for Ukrainian TV series 'Contamin' in 2020.

360.title: 2 13-yr-old students beaten outside Delhi school by group of boys
360.article_body: Two 13-year-old students were allegedly beaten by a group of boys outside their school on February 28 in the Delhi Cantonment area, the police said. The boys are students of Kendriya Vidyalaya No. 2 and were returning home when the incident took place. One student sustained injuries on his head and had to get stitches, the boy's father said.

361.title: Navi Mumbai policeman goes missing after alleging senior of harassment
361.article_body: Manesh Bachhav, a Navi Mumbai police sub-inspector, has been missing since Saturday afternoon. Bachhav alleged a "corrupt" senior police inspector of harassing him and causing mental trauma, according to a letter he wrote to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and DGP Rajnish Seth. Police started an inquiry into the allegations levelled by Bachhav after his letter went viral on social media.

362.title: Delhi HC refuses to stay AAP govt's order banning discounts on liquor
362.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday refused to stay the AAP government's decision to ban discounts on liquor. Several liquor licence holders had complained against the order, saying that the rules of the game can't be changed after the game has begun. Today, Justice V Kameswar Rao said, "I am dismissing the applications...A detailed order will be uploaded."

363.title: 33% of govt jobs in Tripura will be reserved for women: Amit Shah
363.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on the occasion of International Women's Day said that 33% of government jobs in Tripura would be reserved for women. He said that for the youth of Tripura, BJP will establish a National Forensic Science University. Shah said this while addressing a rally on the completion of four years of the BJP government in Tripura.

364.title: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1, to cost ₹57.51/kg in Delhi
364.article_body: CNG prices have been increased in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1 per kg with effect from Tuesday. In Delhi, one kg CNG will now be costlier by 50 paise and cost ₹57.51 from earlier ₹57.01. The prices in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad have been hiked by ₹1 per kg and CNG in these cities will cost ₹59.58 per kg.

365.title: Leave using any means of transport: Embassy to Indians in Ukraine
365.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine on Tuesday urged its nationals to use the humanitarian corridor, created for evacuation, and leave using any means of transport available while considering their safety. "The...corridor...has been announced...from 1000 hrs on March 8," it said. The embassy added that given the current situation, the creation of the next humanitarian corridor is uncertain.

366.title: Inspector Madhulatha appointed as 1st woman SHO in Hyd
366.article_body: Inspector K Madhulatha was appointed as Hyderabad's first woman Station House Officer (SHO) on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Hyderabad also got its first woman officer to lead a law-and-order (L&O) police station in its 175-year-old history. She took charge as SHO of Lallaguda police station in the presence of Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali.

367.title: Ukraine conflict could lead to 3rd world war: Venezuelan Prez Maduro
367.article_body: The military conflict in Ukraine could lead to a third world war, Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has said. "[The conflict] has global consequences, such as a devastating impact on...prices of oil, petrol and gas, on...cost of food," Maduro added. Notably, President Maduro had expressed "strong support" for Russia and condemned "destabilising actions" of the West following Ukraine's invasion.

368.title: Pub in UK installs Putin's photo in its toilets, shares pic
368.article_body: A UK pub has installed a photograph of Russian President Vladimir Putin in its toilets to take a stand against invasion of Ukraine. The photo space in the urinals of Raglan Road Irish Bar was previously occupied by former US President Donald Trump. The bar posted a photo on their Instagram account captioned, "Vladimir Putin in the men's loo."

369.title: Natasha and I lost twins in sixth month of pregnancy: Fardeen Khan
369.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has said that his wife Natasha Madhwani suffered a lot because of IVF and added, "It's very hard on your body and your health." He further revealed that he and his wife lost twins in the sixth month of pregnancy. "It was a tough time. She did a live birth, and we lost the babies," he stated.

370.title: 52 Indian sailors stranded in Mykolaiv Port in Ukraine evacuated
370.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine on Tuesday said it intervened in the evacuation of 75 Indian sailors who were stranded in Mykolaiv Port and evacuated 52 of them on Monday. Route constraints precluded the evacuation of the remaining 23 sailors and it is attempting their evacuation on Tuesday, it added. The embassy also evacuated two Lebanese and three Syrian sailors.

371.title: Malaysia to reopen its borders from April 1 with quarantine waiver
371.article_body: Malaysia is set to fully reopen its borders from April 1 and allow quarantine-free entry to vaccinated visitors, PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob said on Tuesday. Visitors will, however, need to take an RT-PCR test two days before departure and a rapid antigen test after arrival in the country. Additionally, Malaysian nationals will be able to resume international travel.

372.title: India to resume regular international flights from March 27 after 2 years
372.article_body: The Centre has decided to resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27 after two years. "International operations shall be subject to strict adherence to Ministry of Health guidelines for international travel," the Civil Aviation Ministry said on Tuesday. The restrictions were in place due to coronavirus pandemic.

373.title: 2 million people have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
373.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Tuesday said that two million people have fled Ukraine since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. It represents the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. Grandi warned that a second wave of refugees from Ukraine is likely to be more vulnerable than the first wave.

374.title: Australia-Pakistan score 1,187 runs for 14 wickets, use 16 bowlers as Test ends in a draw
374.article_body: Australia and Pakistan aggregated 1,187 runs in the first Test in Rawalpindi which witnessed 16 bowlers being used across the five days. The match witnessed four hundreds and four fifties, with Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq slamming two hundreds in the match. The match was Australia's first in Pakistan after 24 years.

375.title: Norway wealth fund puts Adani Ports, 2 others on its watch list
375.article_body: Norway's sovereign wealth fund has put Adani Ports, Canada's Bombardier and South Korea's Hyundai Glovis on its watch list for possible exclusion from investment due to ethical concerns. It said Adani Ports has been put on the watch list for its possible contribution to "serious violations" of human rights because of its involvement in building a port terminal in Myanmar.

376.title: Working hours of Mumbai women police personnel reduced to 8 hours
376.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, the newly-appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey has ordered that women police personnel will be getting eight-hour shifts from Tuesday. The officials reportedly said the new shorter duty time for women personnel will be in force till further orders. The directive aims to help women personnel maintain a healthy work-home balance, they said.

377.title: Putin is a spent force in the world: UK Defence Secretary
377.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a spent force in the world" whatever happens in Ukraine. "This will be Putin's end," Wallace added. "No one will be taking his phone calls in the long term. He has exhausted his army...He's reducing his economy to zero...he has to take responsibility for that," Wallace further said.

378.title: Zelenskyy recalls Ukrainian peacekeepers from UN missions to fight Russia
378.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has signed a decree recalling Ukrainian peacekeepers, along with their weapons and hardware, participating in UN missions to assist in the war effort. The move is aimed at strengthening Ukrainian Army against Russian aggression, Deputy Head of Ukrainian President's Office Andrii Sybiha said, publishing the order. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

379.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown in Thane, no injuries reported
379.article_body: Fire department officials confirmed that a fire broke out at a scrap godown located near the HP petrol pump on the Shilphata-Mahape road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. While no casualties or injuries have been reported so far, fire tenders were immediately rushed to the spot to control the fire.

380.title: Shell to stop buying oil, gas from Russia, apologises for buying cargo after invasion
380.article_body: British oil giant Shell has announced that it will stop purchasing Russian oil and gas, with CEO Ben van Beurden apologising for buying a cargo of Russian crude oil after Ukraine invasion. "As an immediate first step, we will stop all spot purchases of Russian crude oil, shut service stations, aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia," Shell said.

381.title: All sanction options against Russia being considered: Netherlands
381.article_body: Netherlands Foreign Minister Wopke Hoekstra said on Tuesday that all sanction options against Russia are under consideration, including those on Russian energy. Hoekstra added, however, all EU nations should be able to "bear the burden" if they're imposed. EU buys 45% of its gas, around one-third of its oil and nearly half of its coal from Russia, Reuters reported.

382.title: Ashwin is much more difficult to face than Harbhajan: Gautam Gambhir
382.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the off-spinner who is more difficult to face between Ravichandran Ashwin and Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir named Ashwin as he is "far more" accurate and tough because of his speed variations. "As a batter, I would hate to face Ashwin," said Gambhir. "Harbhajan was more beautiful to watch," stated the former Indian cricketer.

383.title: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy to address British parliament
383.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday will virtually address the British parliament. It will be the first time a foreign president addresses the House of Commons. "Every parliamentarian wants to hear directly from the president, who will be speaking to us live from Ukraine, so this is an important opportunity for the House," Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle said.

384.title: President Kovind confers 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women
384.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind conferred the 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women for 2020 and 2021, on International Women's Day on Tuesday. An initiative of Women and Child Development Ministry, the award recognises exceptional work towards women's empowerment. Social entrepreneur Anita Gupta, tribal activist Ushaben Dineshbhai Vasava and innovator Nasira Akhter, among others, were the latest awardees.

385.title: Raghavan is among the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today: Sanjay
385.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said that he is looking forward to working under filmmaker Sriram Raghavan's vision in the film 'Merry Christmas'. "Raghavan is one of the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today," Sanjay added. The film also features Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi. "I have been in awe of his style of storytelling ever since I saw 'Badlapur'," Sanjay stated.

386.title: There's lot of diverse content across Hollywood today: Kal Penn
386.article_body: Actor Kal Penn stated there's a lot of diverse content in Hollywood currently than there was a decade ago "More great projects with...interesting, funny...diverse stories [are there] for audiences to enjoy, like 'Hot Mess Holiday'," he added. When asked about working in Bollywood, Penn said, "I'm trying to produce more in Bollywood, there's an exciting opportunity with the OTT platforms."

387.title: Clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency: FM
387.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government sees "clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency". She added that the digital rupee is a conscious call taken in consultation with RBI and that the government expects the digital currency to come out from RBI this year itself. "I see a possibility for revenue in [digital currency]," she said.

388.title: 4 dead, 2 injured after car collides with truck in UP's Kanpur
388.article_body: Four people were killed and two others were seriously injured after a car collided with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur district, police said. The incident occurred on Monday night when the car driver tried to overtake a vehicle but collided with the speeding truck coming from the opposite direction. The car was going towards Ghatampur, police said.

389.title: Apple's Russia exit may cost $3 mn/day in iPhone sales: Report
389.article_body: Apple might lose at least $3 million in iPhone sales revenue daily or $1.14 billion annually as it announced to pull out from the Russian market, Lithuania-based online shopping portal Burga reported. Apple accounts for 15% of the Russian smartphone sales to rank third overall. South Korea's Samsung occupies the top position with 34%.

390.title: Kumble would've taken over 1,000 int'l wickets with DRS: Kohli's coach
390.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said Anil Kumble would have taken more than 1,000 wickets in international cricket if he had DRS, having retired with 956 wickets. "During my time..., if the ball struck the pads of the batter while...on the front foot, the umpire would...give it not out," added Rajkumar. Kumble is India's top wicket-taker in Tests.

391.title: School uniforms worth ₹351 cr distributed to students during COVID in MP
391.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government distributed school uniforms worth ₹351 crore to over 1.17 crore students across 50 districts of the state during COVID-19 pandemic in financial year 2020-21, School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar said. While "radio school" (online) was started for Classes 1 to 8, students from Classes 9 to 12 studied under "Hamara Ghar Hamara Vidyalaya" plan, he added.

392.title: To say that govt controlled oil prices due to polls is incorrect: Puri
392.article_body: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said oil prices are determined by global prices and "to say that the government had controlled oil prices due to elections is not correct". "We'll take decisions in the best interest of our citizens," he added. This comes after global oil prices reached close to the $140/barrel mark on Monday.

393.title: IMD issues yellow alert in parts of Maharashtra, Gujarat & MP
393.article_body: The IMD issued a yellow alert for Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Maharashtra forecasting thunderstorms for the next two days. The wind confluence and a trough in easterlies run from the southeast Arabian Sea off Kerala coast to Konkan coast in lower tropospheric levels and these conditions are likely to bring thunderstorms and rains in these states, the weather agency said.

394.title: Raipur journalist held for political satire now charged with prostitution
394.article_body: Nilesh Sharma, a journalist who was earlier arrested by Raipur Police for allegedly writing satirical articles on Congress MLAs, has now been charged with three new sections. According to the police, they have found pornographic content in Sharma's phone and have sent him to jail charging him with sections under the IT Act and prevention of immoral trafficking law.

395.title: Dish TV to move SAT against SEBI order to disclose its AGM voting results
395.article_body: Dish TV on Tuesday said it will move the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's interim order directing Dish TV to disclose its annual general meeting's (AGM) voting results. SEBI had ordered Dish TV on Monday to disclose AGM results within 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and directed depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors.

396.title: How will the new UPI work on feature phones and in offline mode?
396.article_body: To use RBI's UPI123Pay, users need to link their bank account with their feature phones and set up a UPI pin with a debit card. They can call an Interactive Voice Response number to transfer money. They can also use a missed call payment feature to send money to a merchant/shop or tap their phones on a sound-based payments device.

397.title: 15th round of India and China military talks on March 11: Reports
397.article_body: India and China will hold the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on March 11, reports claimed on Tuesday. The talks will be held at the Chushul Moldo meeting point in India. The 14 rounds of talks held so far have led to a resolution in the North and South Bank of Pangong Tso, Galwan and Gogra Hot Spring areas.

398.title: Bye bye, good riddance: Simon Jordan on Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich
398.article_body: Terming Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich as one of the "worst things" for English football, ex-Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan said, "[Abramovich's legacy] is awful...good riddance, bye bye." "He's part of a regime that's got a Mafioso boss that's gone mad...in Vladimir Putin," added Jordan. Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier called Abramovich one of Putin's closest friends.

399.title: Swiggy hires JP Morgan, I-Sec for $800 mn-$1 billion IPO: Reports
399.article_body: Swiggy has hired two investment banks JP Morgan and ICICI Securities for the launch of its $800 million to $1 billion IPO, media reports said citing sources. Swiggy plans to offer about 10% stake in the IPO, which may be a mix of primary and secondary offering. It may file the DRHP with SEBI by June.

400.title: Bengaluru Police detects 7 cases of house break-ins & thefts
400.article_body: DCP (Bengaluru's Whitefield) S Girish took to Twitter on Monday and informed that Bellandur Police detected seven "important" cases of house break-ins and thefts in the city. Girish tweeted that the Bellandur Police was rewarded with appreciation certificates over the same. He also informed that the police recovered 500 grams of gold jewellery from the possession of an offender.

401.title: Income Tax raids premises linked to Aaditya Thackeray's aide
401.article_body: The Income Tax department carried out searches on premises linked to Shiv Sena leader Rrahul Narain Kanal, who is a close aide of Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray. The raid was conducted in connection with alleged tax evasion by BMC Standing Committee's Chairman Yashwant Jadhav. Kanal is a member of BMC's Education Committee and trustee of Shri Sai Baba Sansthan Trust.
